study.title: Incidence, pathogens and resistance patterns of nosocomial infections at a rural hospital in Gabon

design.inclusion_criteria_text: All patients admitted to the departments of surgery, gynecology/obstetrics and internal medicine were screened daily for signs and symptoms of hospital-acquired infections.
design.exclusion_criteria_text: Patients with nosocomial infections that arose after discharge were not detected due to lack of follow-up. Patients receiving antipyretics may have been missed except for surgical site infection cases.

eligibility.population: All patients admitted to surgery, gynecology/obstetrics, and internal medicine departments screened daily for nosocomial infections.
eligibility.intervention: Routine perioperative antibiotic prophylaxis (aminopenicillin with/without β-lactamase inhibitor or ceftriaxone); therapeutic antibiotic regimens as per local availability.

populations.description: All patients admitted to surgery, gynecology/obstetrics, and internal medicine departments (n=2925).
populations.comorbidities_key: Median age 30 (22–42) years; 65% female, 35% male; comorbidities not specified.

provenance.text_snippet: During the six months period of this study, 2925 patients were admitted to the participating wards of the Albert Schweitzer Hospital.

definitions.resistance_definition_text: Susceptibility to antibiotics was tested using the microdilution method according to CLSI guidelines. ESBL production confirmed by disc diffusion and double-disks method. Methicillin-resistance confirmed for cefoxitin-resistant S. aureus using PBP2a-agglutination test.
definitions.outcome_definitions_text: Nosocomial infection defined per Robert Koch Institute (RKI) based on CDC guidelines. Mortality: in-hospital deaths among patients with nosocomial infections. Length of stay: mean and median days reported.

lab_methods.specimen_collection_method: Blood cultures collected in Bactec bottles; wound swabs and urine plated on blood and MacConkey agar.
lab_methods.culture_method: Blood, chocolate, and MacConkey agar; Bactec 9050 incubator for blood cultures.
lab_methods.QC_measures: Good laboratory practice and standard methods for identification.
lab_methods.organism_identification_method: Tube coagulase and latex tests for staphylococci, latex test for streptococci, pyrase testing for enterococci, API-20E and API-20NE for enterobacteriaceae and non-fermenting Gram-negative rods.
lab_methods.lab_capacity_notes: Microbiology laboratory available at the hospital; limited antibiotic spectrum tested due to local availability.

interventions.description: Routine perioperative antibiotic prophylaxis with aminopenicillin with/without β-lactamase inhibitor or ceftriaxone.

provenance.text_snippet: Antibiotics tested were chosen according to local availability and included penicillin, oxacillin, ampicillin, amoxicillin/clavulanic acid, ceftriaxon, gentamicin, ciprofloxacin, co-trimoxazole, clindamycin, chloramphenicol and erythromycin.

codes.summary: The cumulative incidence of nosocomial infections was low overall, but surgical site infections comprised the largest proportion.

evidence_quotes.quote: The cumulative incidence of nosocomial infections was 1.6 infections per 100 patients in six months (95% CI 1.1 - 2.0) or 3.6 infections per 1000 in-patient days (95% CI 2.6 – 4.6).

provenance.text_snippet: The cumulative incidence of nosocomial infections was 1.6 infections per 100 patients in six months (95% CI 1.1 - 2.0)...

codes.subtheme: resistance patterns and rates by pathogen/antibiotic
codes.summary: High rates of ESBL-producing E. coli and K. pneumoniae were found among nosocomial infection isolates.

evidence_quotes.quote: Eight (40%) of 20 identified E. coli and Klebsiella spp. strains were ESBL-producing organisms.
One of our most striking findings was the fact that five of 14 E. coli strains (36%) and three of six K. pneumoniae strains (50%) were ESBL-producers.

provenance.text_snippet: One of our most striking findings was the fact that five of 14 E. coli strains (36%) and three of six K. pneumoniae strains (50%) were ESBL-producers.

codes.summary: Inappropriate use of antibiotics, including routine prophylaxis of long duration, is a major factor favoring infection with multi-resistant pathogens.

evidence_quotes.quote: These findings support the view that inappropriate use of anti-infectious medications including routine antibiotic prophylaxis of long duration is a major factor favouring infection with multi-resistant pathogens.

provenance.text_snippet: These findings support the view that inappropriate use of anti-infectious medications including routine antibiotic prophylaxis of long duration is a major factor favouring infection with multi-resistant pathogens.

codes.summary: Nosocomial infections led to increased length of stay and in-hospital mortality among affected patients.

evidence_quotes.quote: With a mean stay of 27 (range: 4–108) days, patients with nosocomial infections stayed in hospital for 23 days longer than the average patient.
During the study four (11%) of the patients with nosocomial infections died.

provenance.text_snippet: With a mean stay of 27 (range: 4–108) days, patients with nosocomial infections stayed in hospital for 23 days longer than the average patient.

codes.summary: Detailed surveillance of nosocomial infections is mandatory to reduce hospital-acquired infections and improve patient outcomes.

evidence_quotes.quote: We also showed that at small rural hospitals detailed surveillance of nosocomial infections is mandatory to be able to reduce hospital-acquired infections and improve patient outcome.

provenance.text_snippet: We also showed that at small rural hospitals detailed surveillance of nosocomial infections is mandatory to be able to reduce hospital-acquired infections and improve patient outcome.

codes.summary: Introducing antibiotic stewardship measures, including appropriate use of antibiotics, is recommended to reduce multiresistant pathogens.

evidence_quotes.quote: These could, for example, consist of introducing antibiotic stewardship measures which includes appropriate use of antibiotic medications in the hospital setting.

provenance.text_snippet: These could, for example, consist of introducing antibiotic stewardship measures which includes appropriate use of antibiotic medications in the hospital setting.
